title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.8 - Unauthorized storage of cargo or property prohibited; storage fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.8 - Unauthorized storage of cargo or property prohibited; storage fees

State Regulations

Unless otherwise provided in a lease or other
agreement, no person shall use any area of an air terminal for storage of cargo
or other property without permission. When the manager deems that such use will
not interfere with the operation of an air terminal, and such permission is
granted, the charge for such use shall be at the rate of two cents per square
foot for a period of 10 days or less, provided, however, that there shall be a
minimum charge of $1 for any such period. If, notwithstanding the above
prohibition, a person uses such areas for storage as aforesaid, without first
obtaining such permission, then the manager shall have authority to order the
cargo or other property removed or to cause the same to be removed and stored
at the expense of the owner or consignee thereof, without liability for damage
thereto arising from or out of such removal or storage. The above rate shall
apply for the time said cargo or other property has been stored at the air
terminal in other than leased areas. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1260.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
